Questions.Question: Who authored the quote 'The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing'?
Questions.Explanation: Socrates, the ancient Greek philosopher, coined this thought-provoking quote emphasizing self-awareness and humility.

Questions.Question: Which musician said, 'The beautiful thing about learning is that no one can take it away from you'?
Questions.Explanation: These words hold valuable insight from the legendary blues guitarist B.B. King, highlighting the enduring nature of knowledge.

Questions.Question: Who articulated the quote 'Know thyself'?
Questions.Explanation: Socrates, known for his profound wisdom, emphasized self-discovery and introspection through the timeless phrase 'Know thyself.'

Questions.Question: Which poet penned the words 'The only way to do great work is to love what you do'?
Questions.Explanation: This quote is attributed to the late tech visionary Steve Jobs, advocating passion as the cornerstone of achievement.

Questions.Question: Who expressed the quote 'The unexamined life is not worth living'?
Questions.Explanation: Socrates, a seminal figure in philosophy, espoused the necessity of self-reflection and conscious living through this profound statement.

Questions.Question: Which author remarked 'The only journey is the one within'?
Questions.Explanation: German poet Rainer Maria Rilke encapsulates the essence of inner exploration in this thought-provoking quote about self-discovery.

Questions.Question: Which renowned artist stated 'I am seeking, I am striving, I am in it with all my heart'?
Questions.Explanation: Vincent van Gogh's impassioned words emphasize commitment and dedication to the pursuit of personal growth and self-discovery.
